Comment 3: 
Stopping early is rarely a good choice for a compiler, because it then takes more runs
to find and fix all the errors.  It's only appropriate when the compiler has gotten so
mixed up that the remaining errors are misleading.  I don't see that as being the case
here.  The error messages on line 10 are accurate and they point to the real problem,
although obviously not as directly as the error on line 17.
